section.title: Goal
section.para: The goal of this exercise is to create a first basic version the leave request process diagram.
At this stage the process is executable but has limited value from the business point of view as it does not yet contain forms or data. We will extend it in the upcoming exercises.

section.title: Instructions
section.para: In order to do the exercise, create a "Leave request diagram" diagram in version 1.0 contain a "Leave request" process in version 1.0.
The process should contain the following BPMN elements:

listitem.para: A terminate end event named "End - Request processed"

para.emphasis: Set the diagram and process names.

listitem.para: Click anywhere on the background of the diagram design area but outside of the process pool (this will select the diagram).
Navigate to the "General / Diagram" tab and click on "Edit".
Enter "Leave request diagram" as the diagram name and "Leave request" for the pool name.

para.emphasis: Rename the start event into "Fill request".

listitem.para: Select the start event from the diagram.
Navigate to the "General / General" tab and enter the new name.

para.emphasis: Rename the human task into "Validate request".
Add a terminate end event named "End - Request processed".

listitem.para: Select the human task, perform drag and drop from the contextual event icon (A) and select the terminate end event (B).
Once the event is created, rename it.

para.emphasis: Make sure that your diagram matches this:

listitem.para: Click on the "Save" button from the Studio's top menu bar.
Click on the "Run" button from the Studio's top menu bar and go through the different forms.
